function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Increased domestic internet use leading to potential spread of contagious diseases through shared devices and networks.","Impact":"Increased risk of spreading contagious diseases within households and communities.","Mitigation":"Promote proper hygiene and sanitation practices, encourage the use of personal devices, and implement regular cleaning and disinfection protocols for shared devices and surfaces.","Technologies":"Smart devices for contactless control and monitoring, IoT sensors for occupancy and airflow monitoring, and UV-C disinfection technology for surfaces and devices.","People":"Residents, family members, and individuals living in close proximity in urban areas.","Owner":"Public health authorities, local governments, and community organizations."},{"Description":"Major decline in fixed office internet access leading to increased reliance on shared public Wi-Fi networks.","Impact":"Heightened risk of spreading contagious diseases through shared public Wi-Fi networks in densely populated areas.","Mitigation":"Implement secure and encrypted Wi-Fi networks, promote the use of VPNs for secure connections, and raise awareness about the risks of using public Wi-Fi for sensitive activities.","Technologies":"Secure Wi-Fi protocols, VPN software for secure connections, and encryption technologies for data protection.","People":"Office workers, commuters, and individuals accessing public Wi-Fi in urban settings.","Owner":"Employers, network administrators, and internet service providers."},{"Description":"Implementation of 5G and potential future transition to 6G increasing connectivity and data transfer speeds.","Impact":"Rapid transmission of information and data may lead to faster spread of misinformation and panic related to contagious diseases.","Mitigation":"Promote digital literacy and critical thinking skills, strengthen cybersecurity measures to combat misinformation, and establish reliable channels for disseminating accurate public health information.","Technologies":"AI-driven content moderation, blockchain technology for secure data verification, and data analytics for identifying and addressing misinformation.","People":"General population, social media users, and individuals consuming digital content.","Owner":"Social media platforms, technology companies, and public health agencies."}]}
